badge_template_activities.title: The Institute for Excellence in Health & Social Systems (IEHSS) Team Coaching Program consists of at least five mandatory sessions and one optional session. Session two is a four-day in-person session.

Participants submit and present three progress reports during the course of the program and receive feedback from faculty and course participants. The reports include updates about their team's improvement work as well as their own development as a team coach.

Participants submit final deliverables that include reports about the status of their improvement team, how they will transition from the team, a team coaching experience reflection and an individualized coaching plan for personal and professional development as a team coach.

8710d89a-7dca-4fe2-9d89-fb4c7e12fe1d.name: Digital Presentation Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Hampshire

badge_template_activities.title: Faculty participants will engage in active, rigorous discussion boards. Successful participation includes creating one original post that analyzes and applies a reading from the module.That post must quote the reading, and explore ways it serves as a foundational concept. Participants must then identify ways that content can play a role in the participant’s teaching practice. Participants must also respond and engage with at least two additional discussion board posts.

Deliverable Assessment: Faculty participants are asked to develop, remix or revise an assignment that leverages digital presentations in the classroom. This deliverable is multipronged and includes an assignment description, the course it targets, and a list of student learning outcomes that it addresses. Participants are also asked to source media and other digital resources to accompany the assignment. Faculty must submit a sample of the completed assignment.

Module Assessment: To evaluate faculty participant success in the Digital Presentation Module,  HELM instructors review the rigor and substance of faculty submissions to the Digital Presentation discussion board, and also their engagement with the HELM cohort. Additionally, instructors use a rubric to evaluate deliverables for substance, classroom efficacy and target audience engagement. Faculty participants will spend approx 6 hours on module completion. completion.

5e601dc8-15fd-454c-81f4-d1a0e5dfaac3.description: The earner understands digital signal processing theory and practice, including coverage of discrete time signals and systems, frequency domain transforms and practical spectral analysis, digital filter terminology and design, and sampling and reconstruction of continuous time signals as well as signal modeling, parameter estimation, optimal filtering and decision making, with application to adaptive filters, echo cancellation, channel equalization and parametric spectral estimation.
5e601dc8-15fd-454c-81f4-d1a0e5dfaac3.name: Digital Signal Processing

89f1e7d9-7a3c-4574-88a2-623d56b9841c.description: Earners of the Post-Masters Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) Certificate have completed 29 credit hours with clinical practicum experience through a minimum of up to 750 clinical hours and two on-campus residencies. Earners have learned to care for the psychiatric and mental health needs of patients throughout the lifespan while ensuring patient safety through appropriate treatment plans.

issuer.summary: issued by University of New Hampshire

alignments.name: Credit Hours
alignments.description: This certificate program offers 29 credit hours

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed the following coursework: Neurobiology of Mental Disorders, Foundations of Psychiatric-Mental Health Practice & Assessment, Psychopharmacology of Mental Health Disorders Across the Lifespan I and II, Diagnosis & Management of Mental Health Disorders Across the Lifespan I and II, Mental Health & Special Populations

Nurse practitioners are prepared to add advanced psychiatric skills of therapy, prescribe psychiatric medications & clinical management needed to treat patients with mental illness & chronic medical co-morbidities. Learners have received a lifespan perspective in psychiatric mental health diagnostic reasoning, psychopharmacology, individual psychotherapies & management of complex psychiatric illnesses giving the student an evidence­-based framework for complete psychiatric-mental health care.
Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practicum (750 hours) and clinical courses are 2-3 credits each totaling 29 credits.
After earning the certificate, earners are qualified to sit for the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Certification Examination.
